Print This Page
Cambridge City
MA

Resolution
RES 2025 #94
Order Adopted
Apr 28, 2025 5:30 PM

Congratulations to Lieutenant Thomas Glynn on his retirement from the Cambridge Police Department.

Information

Department:City Clerk's Office, PTSponsors:Councillor Paul F. Toner, Councillor Ayesha M. Wilson, Mayor E. Denise Simmons
Category:Congratulations

Attachments

Version History
  1. Printout

Body

WHEREAS:

The City Council has learned that Lieutenant Thomas Glynn retired on February 7, 2025, after 31 years of dedicated service to the City of Cambridge Police Department; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Lieutenant Glynn was sworn in as a police officer in 1998, promoted to Sergeant on September 29, 2010, and further promoted to the rank of Lieutenant on April 11, 2022; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

During his tenure, Lieutenant Glynn served in various units within the departments, including Patrol Operations Criminal Investigations, Training & Certification Unit, Traffic Enforcement Unit, Special Response Team and Professional Standards; and

 

 

WHEREAS:

Lieutenant Glynn received numerous accolades during his career, including the Commissioner Robert C. Haas Unit Ribbon Award in both 2006 and 2007, Army Military Ribbon in 2015, the Commissioner’s Unit Award Ribbon in 2016 – presented to those members of a Unit, who acting as a team, displayed extraordinary heroism, determination, and/or esprit de corps in accomplishing a mission under difficult or hazardous conditions as to set it apart from others participating in the same mission,  and the Albert G. Eckardt Police Commendation Medal - awarded for an outstanding act characterized by obvious self-sacrifice while facing personal danger; now therefore be it

 

 

RESOLVED:

That the City Council go on record extending its deepest appreciation to Lieutenant Thomas Glynn for his unwavering commitment to the City of Cambridge and its residents and wishes him good health and happiness in his retirement; and be it further

 

 

RESOLVED:

That the City Clerk be and hereby is requested to forward a suitably engrossed copy of this resolution to Lieutenant Thomas Glynn on behalf of the entire City Council.

 

 

Meeting History

Apr 28, 2025 5:30 PM  City Council Regular Meeting
RESULT:ORDER ADOPTED [8 TO 0]
YEAS:Burhan Azeem, Marc C. McGovern, Patricia Nolan, Jivan Sobrinho-Wheeler, Paul F. Toner, Ayesha M. Wilson, Catherine Zusy, E. Denise Simmons
ABSENT:Sumbul Siddiqui
